review.title: Skip this hotel.
review.reviewText: First off  the front desk guy is the one who runs the hotel and he is a total jerk. Doesn't even look you in the face or eyes as you conversate with him about the reservation placed. Secondly, everything is hand written, we got a booked a 2bedroom and he "gave it" to someone else, told us he would accommodate us in the morning- so we kept following up with him and the guy during the night shift and they're both aggogant people who just brushed off the questions. Never have straight answers and contradicted each other. Third, we ordered room service and it was simple, pancakes... Dear Lord! 2.5hrs later and nothing. We called to follow up since we were about to head downtown and the cooks said "it's on it's way, we already cooked it".. 5min later they call us back only to tell us they ran out of food and can't complete our order! 2.5hrs later... The hotel personal just kind of hangs out in the lobby and sits there looking bored and staring at you as you pass by, kind of oddly of them to not find anything to do buy sit and stare. But I mean, you get what you pay for at this hotel... And did I meantion roaches?.. Yep. Also, rock hard pillows... Wifi doesn't work, extremely noisy by 7am.. So enjoy your stay, as for me? This hotel is never in the future for us again.
review.negativeRemarks: The personal needs improvement.

review.title: Excellent staff. Updated rooms. Big and spacious.
review.reviewText: We have been staying at this hotel for the past 10 years and so happy to see that this year our room was updated. Very big and spacious room.

review.title: Quiet and close to everything
review.reviewText: For an old hotel it was as expected    Water slow to heat up, weak air conditioning, but the common area was nice and the staff accommodating

review.title: Nice no-frills hotel close to tourist attractions
review.reviewText: I have stayed at this hotel four times.  It is inexpensive, and close to many tourist attractions.  Rooms are clean and the staff is helpful.  Wi-fi is in the lobby only, but at least the lobby is pleasant and comfortable.  The hotel is not right next to any particular tourist attraction, but is within short walking distance of many.  This is a good hotel for the budget-minded traveller.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, price, staff.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is a few blocks from the Cathedral, the main plazas, Hospicio Caba√±as, and other attractions.  Parque Agua Azul is about 10 blocks south.

review.title: Good location for historical access
review.reviewText: Friendly helpful staff. Good location to historical center. We've stayed here before and returned because of the above comments.

review.title: Berry berry bad
review.reviewText:
Dirty room bugs,everywhere no t Google
Bad experience

managementResponses.response: Thanks for staying with us, we work hard to make our guests happy. We appreciate your feedback!

review.title: conveniently located
review.reviewText: We stayed ten days at San Francisco Plaza Hotel and we were able to visit many historical places and museums on foot. We walked to different food venues when we wanted to eat out and we enjoy a great Calandria ride around Centro Historico. The staff at the hotel schedule a tour to Tequila and a tour to Tlaquepaque for us and we had a great time, we always felt welcome at the hotel and the room was always clean and confortable.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean and quiet, the staff was helpful and friendly and the building is well kept.
review.negativeRemarks: the service in the restaurant and installing mini refrigerators in the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: hotel is centrally located and most historical sites, museums and shopping areas are within walking distance. tours to Tonala, Tequila, Chapala.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for staying with us, we work hard to make our guests happy. We appreciate your feedback!

review.reviewText: Noisy at night and poor ventilation. So if you open the window to let air in, you can't sleep because of the noise.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for staying with us, we work hard to make our guests happy. We appreciate your feedback!

review.title: Close to everything....it was located in the middl
review.reviewText: It was located in the middle of the Historic district and night life bars and clubs all around.....

review.title: Internet sucks
review.reviewText: They should not advertise wifi because is not such a thing. The signal is very poor If any

review.title: Colonial Hotel close to Main Plaza
review.reviewText:
Staff at this colonial hotel were friendly, and welcoming.  The rooms are basic, but large with older T.V.'s. The water was always hot when showering during my 1 week stay. The hotel is located on a small unattractive plaza with nightclubs and bars in its proximity, however, it is a short walk to the main plaza and Cathedral, the Degollado Theater, and other major attractions.  City buses are easily accessible from this location.  The hotel has a Mexican-style breakfast buffet and a la carte breakfast menu that included cereal, hotcakes, yogurt, etc.  The dining room/kitchen is open all day until 10 PM, and has Mexican items as well as burgers, club sandwiches, salads, etc.  Prices are reasonable and the food is good.  My favourite was the chicken consomm√© soup.  There is wifi, although slow at times when accessing from room. 
Overall, this hotel is a good value, and would stay here again when visiting Guadalajara.
review.positiveRemarks: good value

review.title: Great location - we like the old Mexican style
review.reviewText:
We loved the location of the San Francisco Hotel. Only a few blocks from the market and close to our favorite restaurant La Chata.  The lobby is wonderful - old style Mexican with lots of canaries and parakeets in cages. Lots of plants -it's a nice place to sit after walking the city.

The bed was so good - the perfect firmness.  No bathtub, which is true of most Mexican hotels.  Some of the staff were not the best, but we were able to communicate and receive what we needed.

A very good bargain- i plan to stay there again when we are back in Guadalajara
review.positiveRemarks: Almost everything
review.negativeRemarks: Some of the staff were not very friendly
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic.  The market.  Streets with similar types of businesses on the same street - for example wedding and special occasion dresses, electronics.

review.reviewText: The staff is great.  Internet signal is a bit weak.  Hotel is located at walking distance from many attractions and delicious restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: The beds are a bit hard.
review.locationRemarks: Well located to downtown Guadalajara. Many activities at walking distance.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Nice hotel near central area to all historic sites
review.positiveRemarks: Loved location and beautiful hotel
review.negativeRemarks: If they could provide free continental breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Hotel is walking distance to churches, shopping stores, museum, and restaurants

review.reviewText: Found Roaches in the room, that was not sanitary, the rooms could be a bit more cleaner and a bit more sanitized. If these changes were made Yes I would recommend my Family and Friends
review.positiveRemarks: Staff and house keepers were very nice and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: A bit more  cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: Is very good, walk to the Parks and Churches

review.title: Nice hotel near Historic Center, very important.
review.reviewText:
Being in the heart of Plaza Tapatia was a BIG PLUS for this hotel. You walk everywhere.

Clean, inexpensive.
review.negativeRemarks: Internet Connection, poor.

review.reviewText: Excellent  location , great price and the hotel its really nice. It required a little bit more cleaniness

review.title: It is bad hotel i couldn't stay more than 2 houres
review.reviewText: It is bad hotel i couldn't stay more than 2 houres
review.positiveRemarks: nothing
review.negativeRemarks: change everything
review.locationRemarks: dungarees area

review.title: Historic Hotel near the Zona Historico
review.reviewText: Overall, the hotel was fine, near the central and historical districts of Guadalajara.  Also very near to the gay nightclub scene if that's what you're looking for.  However, the building is drafty and dusty in places.  (The section we stayed in seemed to be used the most, as the dust was not present in our room.)  Too bad more people don't stay there so they can use the other sections of (what turned out to be) an enormous place.  It should be noted that the neighborhood is not the best -- it was very dark at night and I wound up stepping into a 2-foot hole in the pavement just around the corner from the hotel.  Took quite a fall and wound up with some nasty bruises on my knee and leg.  Still can't believe the city would allow something like that to be there on a street with NO lights at night and without any sign or indication that the hole was there.  For these reasons, I can't say that I recommend this hotel.

When arrived our room was not ready,we had to wait for an hour but the bad thing was that the front desk person did not even apologize to us he was very rude.Beds and pillows were not comfortable at all ,to hard  but the worse was the problem with roaches .there was hardly any water to take a shower and most of the time was very dirty.
review.positiveRemarks: We like the colonial style ,the patios were very relaxing .
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk people needs to be retrained,on how  to treat people have better skills ,be more pleasant with customers.
review.locationRemarks: Location is not the best is unsafe for people to walk

review.title: Never going again
review.reviewText: They first tried to cheat me out of a day, and just smiled when I told them I was checking out the next day.  maid did not clean the room the day before I checked out.  Hotel keeps getting more run down ---- I stayed there six years ago.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything

review.reviewText: No water pressure in shower. They didn't fix it.i complained 4 times. And just changed the shower head, but pressure was the same. Terrible.

review.title: Colonial-style hotel close to historic downtown
review.reviewText: The hotel has a charming colonial-style, and is centrally located in downtown Guadalaraja. It is not a 4-5 stars hotel, and does not have many of the ameneties found in big business-like hotels. But if you are looking for a good location (close to historic Guadalajara downtown), a relatively safe neighborhood, and a clean place to stay at a REASONABLE price this hotel is a good choice. It is a practical and efficient hotel at a good price/rate. Its location makes it a good choice if you want to stay in downtown Guadalajara. Its "colonial" style and interior patios with chairs to sit down and relax distinguish the hotel from business-like hotels. The hotel staff was friendly and willing to assist you if you need help. I would stay there again if I ever go back to Guadalajara.
review.positiveRemarks: Its colonial-style architecture with interior "patios" (open spaces) to sit down and relax after spending significant time sightseeing the city.
review.negativeRemarks: Internet service (it's not reliable); bathroom may need a touch-up (its condition and appereance could be improved) but it's a clean place.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located; close to historic downtown: about 5-6 blocks from Cathedral, Plaza Constitution & Plaza Guadalajara, Teatro Degollado & Tapatio Bus

review.title: Nice location and ambiance.
review.reviewText:
We only spent two nights there.  Basic accommodations but very nicely maintained with true rustic Mexican ambiance.  Helpful staff...but not accurately informed about the pick up for our tour and we ended up stressed about it given the wrong info.  

Wished they cleaned the water for the birds every day.  They were very entertaining and added to the ambiance.
review.positiveRemarks: Great price and location.  Helpful staff except for the ill info on tour pick up.
review.negativeRemarks: Clean bird water more often.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent .  Walking distance to many attractions.

review.title: Location and staff would be about the best to say.
review.reviewText: When you first arrive it actually looks pretty nice and staff are really professional and nice. But when your in your room you realize that everything is in barely working condition. Bathroom was the worst. I would not recommend this to anyone. Parking is a block away and one of the few positives would be the location. It is about three blocks from downtown.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Facilities in the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything.

review.title: Antique hotel. Good location.
review.reviewText: The best location in downtown gdl. The hotel is located in a historic building.

review.title: Awesome
review.reviewText: Great experience . Near everything and very clean hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is REALLY beautiful, one of the most beautiful I've ever seen. The rooms are great. Only the bathrooms are not so nice.

review.title: Pretty, colonial style 2
review.reviewText:
Nice. Great location. WiFi not of too much use in my room, but fine in the lobby. Ran into friends there while we were all looking for best connection. Management was helpful.
I can't show photos right now I think that this place is an excellent value. Televisions could be upgrade or at least the mounting improved.
My sec ne time there and Ill return.

review.title: Close to the main square
review.reviewText: My husband and i spent 4 nights at this hotel. We loved the ambiance and charm of the hotel. The room was exceptionally clean and we could open the window or use the airconditioning. The staff were very helpful and waking up to the sound of the canaries singing in the morning was wonderful.over all we were quite pleased with the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The ambiance and the many courtyards within the hotel. It was quiet as well with our room overlooking a courtyard we never heard any traffic noise.
review.negativeRemarks: The restaurant could be a little better but there are so many restaurants to chose from in the area.
review.locationRemarks: We were a five minute walk to the main squares which are full of so much history. There are many lovely restaurants and a couple of department stores.

review.title: Walking distance from many historical sights
review.reviewText: Lovely atmosphere, very large room and lovely balcony overlooking atrium area. Good breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is great
review.negativeRemarks: Lunch and dinner menus could be better. Tourist information lacking.

review.title: Creepy Location
review.reviewText: I would not stay any more at this hotel. The intalations are old,covers for the bed looks dirty ,shower towels are old and also looks dirty.You have to walk about 2 blocks to the parking for the hotel. Front desk people are rude when you ask for something

review.title: rooms were pretty rough. we had to turn one down.
review.reviewText:
the second room we got was bigger, and slightly better. furnishings were meager, hot water was spotty. staff was loud early in the morning.

good location, and the staff was helpful and earnest.

review.title: Know what you are booking
review.reviewText:
First time in Guadalajara. Hotel San Francisco is in a great location right in the historical district, two blocks from the busses and five minutes walk from San Juan de Dios and Liberty markets.

The hotel itself is very old and basic in the traditional Mexican style with the rooms built around a series of courtyards. Each courtyard has sitting areas and a fountain. The rooms are basic, don't expect pillow top mattresses here. The rooms and the bed linens were clean, there was lots of hot water and the water pressure was good. One night we returned to the room and the electricity was out but the manager sorted the problem immediately.

There is a small restaurant. We had the Breakfast buffet for aprox $6 cdn. The buffet had a great selection of fresh fruit, yoghurt cottage cheese, muesli. The hot dishes which were plentiful were mainly traditional Mexican dishes. The hotel definitely caters to North American tastes and included in the buffet was made to order omelettes pancakes etc.

The staff are quite simply amazingly friendly and hard working. There was always someone on the front desk who spoke fluent English as well as the restaurant host. The front desk staff advised us on locations, events, bus routes etc. The staff at this hotel provide service above and beyond.

I would recommend this hotel if you are on a budget and can accept basic facilities. Not sure if I will stay there again myself.
review.positiveRemarks: Interior courtyards are beautiful. The staff are tremendous.
review.negativeRemarks: For the price I would say this is good deal. Maybe better mattresses. And Wifi in the rooms would be nice too.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: I had a beautiful room with balcony and a big bed.. friendly staff (Thanks to Yosimar and the lady from the breakfast buffet that made me feel like home) I thought I was at my grandma's house for a moment :) ) If you want to feel that you're staying in old Mexico come to this hotel.. I had a great experience there

review.title: Golf
review.reviewText: Stayed 6 nights - was in Guadalajara to work LOI LPGA golf tournament. Easy walking distance to historic Guadalajara Centro.

review.title: value hotel in historical center
review.reviewText: I have stayed many times in this hotel. It seems to be continually going through upgrades. Now there is an elevator which saves many stairs. The rooms are all quite large. While not luxurious by any standard, they have cable tv, a table and chairs, wi-fi, and vlean, functional bathroom with walk-in Mexican shower. The bed is comfortable. There is a very nice lobby for sitting or reading. The restaurant offers a nice buffet or a la carte breakfast at reasonable prices, and a la carte lunches and dinners. Located in the historical center, walking distance to all those attractions. One should exercise caution in that area at night.

review.title: historic but creepy downtown
review.reviewText: hotel could be nice if it was in some secure area. it looks really strange the downtown and full of weirdos. i believe it is not the safest place in town compared to where interconti or expo located.
review.positiveRemarks: building is nice
review.negativeRemarks: people around
review.locationRemarks: no good

review.title: Nice Hotel. Close to all Centro Historico.
review.reviewText: It remainds me my grandmother,s house in Durango. At the reception the people recomended us a tour including Tonala, Guadalajara and Tlaquepaque with exclusive table at El Patio Restaurant in Tlaquepaque. it is nice if you have do not have lots of time to go by taxi.

review.title: Very good hotel in good location at very good pric
review.reviewText: I have stayed here many times because of the location close to the main Old Squares in Old Town and because of the good price. I don't need a pool, and I rarely turn on the TV. The area is a little run-down, but very safe.
review.positiveRemarks: location and price
review.locationRemarks: Hotel is within 5 to 10 minutes walk of all museums in Old Town.

They offer cheap n nice tours guide about sightseen plAces . They were very helpful when we were late n they fall us by phone n wsit for us... If i go again i wll stay in this hotel again..... Lov it
review.positiveRemarks: The whole place, feel protective n comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms decoration snd the bathrooms are very simple and uncomfortable... Too small and no rug
review.locationRemarks: Near everything park taxis tours sightseen tours restaurants convinience store just right in front

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Good staff, very good food, good air condition. Need more mantenimiento

review.title: Dissappointed
review.reviewText: Kitchen staff was horrible! Forgot us and hostesd was rude and never smiled
review.positiveRemarks: Desighn
review.negativeRemarks: The staff
review.locationRemarks: Good close to main shoppin center

review.title: not a good hotel for gringos.
review.reviewText:
The room was very noisy. The floor shook with every vehicle that passed on the street below. The little plaza in front of the hotel is so dark that you think twice about exploring out at night. After 8:00 pm only 2 out of almost 20 stores are open, everything else is dark. It is a good thing we only stayed from 7:00 pm to 3:30 am of the same night.
NOTE: beware of the taxi driver lurking around the lobby, definitely a friend of the person behind the hotel counter. he spends his time waiting for gringos to take advantage of: Yes, he was there at 3:30 to take us to the airport, alas, he charged 240 pesos, that's around $20 US for a trip that was less than 120 pesos only 10 days before, from the airport to a fabulous hotel about 4 blocks *further* from the airport and closer to the center!!!
by all means go to hotel "frances", it is only about $10-15 US more, but a world away in *everything*.

review.title: It's more of a Motel instead of a Hotel
review.reviewText: The room was ok, it has more of a motel feel than a hotel. It is really an older hotel so don't expect any modern or updated fixtures. The restroom was really big but again really old. My biggest let down was the food, it was not good, not worth the price. The morning buffet was not worth the $75 pesos we paid per person. Dinner was also a let down, they didn't have my first two options so I settled for a hamburger and fries which was not good. The good thing about it was it's location. There were tons of places around the hotel to shop, eat, see, and walk around. It's a good 10-15 minutes away from historical sites so that was fun. If you just need a place to sleep and don't care too much about having luxuries in your hotel definitely stay here. Also, all the staff was really nice and super helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: it's location
review.negativeRemarks: the food and that it was an older hotel
review.locationRemarks: great location, close to a lot of great tourist sites

review.title: Perfect stay
review.reviewText: Nice hotel located close to the central historic area. Safe and friendly, I would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: courtyard
review.locationRemarks: Within two blocks of the center historic area

review.title: Needs work
review.reviewText: It is a very noisy hotel with the traffic noise and the noise from the courtyard. We had to move from the first floor because of the sewer smell from the bathroom. But... The location is very good, close to all attractions and a good price for a city.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and it is a very nice colonial hotel
review.negativeRemarks: Sewer smell
review.locationRemarks: Great, close to everything

review.title: Dissapointed hotel guest
review.reviewText: The room assigned to me was nothing like the pictures in Expedia website. The painting inside the room wa peeling off the wall. Major room disspaointment. Overall decent location, good price and nice lobby. I saw other rooms while they were cleaning that look way more decent than the one I got at the top level of the hotel.!!!! Probably wont stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Lobby
review.negativeRemarks: Room

review.title: Weekend in Guadalajara.
review.reviewText: The hotel rooms were basic, but clean and we enjoyed staying there.
review.positiveRemarks: Quaint Mexican flavor and friendliness of the staff.
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance to most things anyone would want to see in centro.

review.title: Nice Mexican style hotel.
review.reviewText: This is a quaint older-style hotel that is downtown and within walking distance to the market and other attractions. The restaurant is good and reasonably priced. The price was right and we would stay there again.

review.title: Colonial style hotel
review.reviewText: Great location a few blocks from mail plaza and neat old restored building. Very helpful staff.

review.title: Good place to stay in Guadalajara
review.reviewText: Clean, good breakfast, close to the central historic sites. Would stay here again for sure.

review.title: Charming cute hotel
review.reviewText: I have stayed there before. I have seen 3 variations of their rooms. They all vary a bit, but overall they could use a fresh coat of paint and tidy up. This time around we had a room right above the reception area. I do not recommend getting a room in this area. In the middle of the night, I could hear a family checking in and a child running around yelling. After about 20 minutes I decided to call the front desk and asked them what was going on and if they could keep it down. Instead of an apology he stated that the family was checking in and the child was not running around. His representation of he hotel was awful. Considering the price of the hotel maybe I shouldn't be expecting much. Regardless I'm a paying customer and I should have not received that answer. That was my first encounter with staff being rude.
review.positiveRemarks: The feel of he hotel was very charming with he water fountains and birds. Very true to old Mexico.
review.negativeRemarks: I don't recommend getting a room above the reception desk. As much as I loved the birds during the day chirping away, at night I like it quiet.
review.locationRemarks: There is a few bars around, some gay. Didn't bother me at all. For the most part it was great b/c it was so close to the centro.

review.title: Very charming
review.reviewText: On the outside the hotel is freshly painted and very charming. Love the old charm of the fountains and birds chirpping. The rooms could use a fresh coat of paint and a new tub. Overall, good location, nice staff, and free wi-fi!
review.positiveRemarks: He fountains and birds. Mexican hacienda feel with the wrought iron and balconies.
review.negativeRemarks: Update bathtub and better mattress.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the main square. We had a room on the inside where noise was not a factor. Great price

review.title: Not a nice area
review.reviewText: Good value for the money but didn't feel safe walking in the neighborhood!

review.title: Needs comfortable beds and better bathrooms.
review.reviewText: I have been staying here loyally for many years but do not know if I will return. The location is excellent for access to the historic district. The building itself, with its stonework and patios with fountains, is beautiful. The staff are friendly and helpful, and the restaurant is pleasant. For years the hotel was in need of an overhaul, and a lot of work has been done recently. I am not sure if the overhaul is still in progress. The rooms are freshly painted. My main concerns are two: the new beds are extremely hard and uncomfortable; and the bathroom was untouched and much in need of attention. There are mold stains on the bathroom ceiling, and we had to remove the clogged shower head to be able to bathe with a stream of water. The shower door has been removed, meaning the entire bathroom gets wet. We were expecting to stay again in a few days and changed our reservation to another hotel, mainly due to the poor night's sleep. This could be a gem of a reasonably priced hotel if it were not for the beds and the bathrooms. Apart from the rock-hard mattresses, the pillows and linens are of very poor quality, with not even a mattress cover under the sheets. If these can be improved, I will be happy to return. But I cannot recommend the hotel now after such an uncomfortable night.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location to walk to historic district. Beautiful old building with patios and fountains. Friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: beds (very hard mattress, cheap pillows and linens); bathroom/shower
review.locationRemarks: The location is somewhat run down but only a couple of blocks from the historic district. Free parking garage.

review.title: Very nice hotel!!
review.reviewText: Excellent location just few blocks from city center. We were happy with the room we got, nice and clean more than we expected. The staff was very polite and helpful at all times,even gave as advice on places to visit. I will stay at this hotel on my next visit.
review.positiveRemarks: There is a restaurant and the food was really good!!!
review.negativeRemarks: The wi-fi did not work very well.
review.locationRemarks: Great location close to DT and main atractions.

review.title: Good location, good staff, very good price.
review.reviewText:
This is the third time we've stayed at Hotel San Francisco Plaza. It is in the Centro District of Guadalajara, very near the churches, museums, plazas, and restaurants that we like to visit, so the location is great. The staff is pleasant and the hotel itself is very Mexican - lots of statuary, large windows, reasonably large rooms, fountains.

The first room we were given this trip had no outside windows, and only one window that opened partially to a wide hallway. The air conditioner didn't work, and the room felt close and stifling. However, when we asked to be moved, the staff was very accommodating. We were moved to a room overlooking San Francisco Plaza, with great door/windows that opened onto a balcony.

Right across from the hotel on the plaza is a nightclub that was busy and loud for most of the weekend, but other than that, it was a good location.

When we came back a week later, we had a large room overlooking an internal 'plaza' that has a fountain and large cages of birds. It was very pleasant and we went to sleep to the sound of the fountain.

All in all, we've always been pleased with this hotel and we will be back the next time we're in Guadalajara.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff and the environment
review.negativeRemarks: the night club across the street
review.locationRemarks: in Guadalajara's Centro or Historic District. Very central to the places we like to visit in Guad.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: The San Francisco Plaza Hotel is a great hotel for a great price. While it isn't as close to main attractions, it is in decent walking distance. I could get to the main plazas in minutes. The room worked out fine. The bed was clean and the bathroom had hot water. The hotel staff we friendly and very helpful with any questions that we had. One thing to note, the hotel appeared to be in a small gay district. The clubs closest to the hotel seemed to be either gay or lesbian spots; however, this did not limit the experience.
review.positiveRemarks: The courtyards add a nice touch.
review.negativeRemarks: The room warmed up during the day, but cooled off towards the end of the day. I wasn't in the room during the day to have to endure the warmth.
review.locationRemarks: Appeared to be in the gay district, but the hotel is in walking distance to other main attractions. Also, I felt safe in the area.

review.title: Bargain with good location
review.reviewText: Authentic oldfashioned mansion with a lot of charm and a good location, close to city center, but quiet. If you can overlook peeling paint and some general fustiness, you will like it. Breakfast was a rich buffet at a low cost. The beds were very comfortable. The room price was a bargain.
review.positiveRemarks: Genuine old style
review.negativeRemarks: Peeling paint
review.locationRemarks: Great location close to most attractions

review.title: Recommended
review.reviewText: Beautiful building, friendly and attentive staff, ideal location. Just get a room in the back, the street and lobby noise in the front can be a problem.

review.title: Not modern but still nice.
review.reviewText: If you are looking for something modern, this is not the hotel for you. It has an old castle smell, small tv's and no ceiling fans. BUT, it makes up for it with its hacienda feel, the openness of the place, and its uniqueness. I had a pleasant stay. I recommend it for someone that is looking for something different than your run of the mill hotel. A nice Mex experience.
review.positiveRemarks: The open feel, hacienda look, friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Small TV's, no ceiling fan, stuffy smell.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown Guadalajara

review.title: DONT STAY HERE!
review.reviewText:
I was extremely disappointed in this hotel. The room was a decent size but that was about it. The side tables where cracked down the middle, the glass casing on the light fixtures where broken. The bed frame looked like someone took a hammer to it. The bathroom was gross. Not to mention the blankets had weird stains on it that looked like dry blood.

Outside the hotel... is tranny heaven. There is a tranny/gay bar and they play music all night long (quite loudly) and what looked like prostitutes hanging out outside. This was my first time in Guadalajara and I thought it was going to be a lot nicer. I'm sure there are other places that are nicer but not this one. It felt like I was stuck in a bad "red light" district shady hotel.

The late night receptionist (a shady looking guy) looked like he was really high. I grabbed a taxi early in the morning and got the hell out of there. I did not feel safe, I did not feel comfortable... I am definitely going to dish out for a better hotel next time.

I didn't really get to eat there so I can't comment on the food. This is definitely not a place for a family to go to. I knew it wasn't going to be the best (you get what you pay for) but I was scared to use the bathroom it was so gross... not to mention sleep in the bed (hard and uncomfortable) with all the weird stains on the sheets.
review.positiveRemarks: It has wireless internet.
review.negativeRemarks: Weird stains on the sheets.
review.locationRemarks: "red light district" but worse.

review.title: explore warm colonial hotel
review.reviewText: is are 3 star hotel, i always stay in this hotel , right in the town center, only 4 blocks to catedral and other atractions, Guru Tour travlers like the hotel so mutch.
review.positiveRemarks: just mi favorit hotel in Guadalajara,
review.negativeRemarks: dont forget to try the breakfast, best wat i had in Mexico
review.locationRemarks: superb

review.title: so so
review.reviewText: Good value and great location but a little run down. The room we were assigned was not clean (beds not made etc) and they had to give us another room. The bathroom was old and runned down (with a funky smell). location was great, 3 blocks away from the Cathedral plaza and lots a great little restaurants near by.

review.title: Room was fine for the price. Food was good.
review.reviewText: This is an old hotel, near the center of Guadalajara, which is good if you plan to walk to major city attractions. Food was good and the room was just what I expect for the price I paid, so was fine at the end. Th food was very good, with years of experience. Due to I have to leave the hotel one day before the original checkout date, I ask the manager to compensate this night in any way but he refuses, so I lost one paid night. I was expecting at least a free orange juice on my breakfast.

review.title: Totally different as described
review.reviewText: N

review.title: Great hotel, very affordable
review.reviewText: The convenience of the location and especially the friendliness of the staff have made my three stays here very enjoyable, and its so affordable!

review.title: San Francisco Plaza... At your Own Risk
review.reviewText: The hotel is very centrally located, but the area can be dangerous at night. I was walking back from a club, and was stopped by the police. After frisking me, they let me go, but stole $500 USD from my pocket. I reported it, but that's a waste of time. With all the toursist going fo the Pan American Games, they should be very careful of the local cops. There is no elevator in the hotel, so anyone who can't do stairs will have to stay on the first floor. The room was spacious, with very tall ceilings. The A/C worked well, but there must be a master control because at night, the air coming out was not cold. The furniture was old and falling apart, but the hotel is charing overall. The breakfast buffet is excellent, especially for 75 pesos (around $6.95/person).

review.title: Beautiful hotel, very affordable
review.reviewText: The first time I stayed here I was won over by the beauty of the lobby, the size and comfort of my room, the sound of horse's hooves on the street outside (pulling carriages), the statues and plants and even live birds adorning the dining room. Have stayed here a second time and found it as satisfying as the first.

review.title: Historic Mexican Experience
review.reviewText: San Francisco Plaza Hotel is a charming facility if one appreciates an authentic Mexican experience. It's a historic hotel. The restaurant is fine for breakfast or lunch - excellent service and good value.

review.title: Un-Happy Client
review.reviewText: I chose this Hotel because I like the extructure it was pretty much what I was expenting. The service is not so good. No help with our lagage whne we arrived and we had a lot includins a stroller and a baby and we had to take the stairs with all. The food is good. The bad part is that my money was stolen from my room from my wallet and a miracle happend right after I called the police the money was found in the bathroom trash can, funny haaa? No one care to say I am Sorry or nothing the guy at the reception was rude and not professional at all, they have no customer service experience. My brother room had a clug bathroom and the guy at the reception expected us to fix it. The area is not nice, lots of nasty bars and it stiks. All I can say is that next time I will NOT stay or recommend this Hotel. No wonder the price here for it is sheap!

review.title: "Nothing fancy but good value"
review.reviewText: The hotel is very conveniently located and within walking distance to all of the historic buildings. There is a very nice daily breakfast buffet. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are very basic and plain. The bathrooms really need improvements.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Parking is a big problem because it far from hotel. Also, there are no elevators. It is in the downtown area but not worth the money. The TV was not working properly.

review.title: cant wait to go back next year
review.reviewText: the people from houseekeping are good

review.title: Stay away from this hotel!
review.reviewText: Relocated to the ground floor,from 2nd floor,as a/c was not working.They dont have elevator.Even,if it is on the 2nd flr,it feels like you negotiated 4 floors,as steps are tall.Bathroom wouldnt close,door was not fixed.One has to hold the door,if in use,or non users have to step out.Staff were not sensitive to guests sleep comfort,they were conversing,joking loud, even at the wee hours of the morning.The only commendable about this hotel was the food and our chambermaid.She was very meticulous in cleaning up our room.However,willl not stay from this hotel again.

review.title: If you want to sleep dont stay here!!
review.reviewText: Will NEVER stay there again!!!! staff was great~ room smelled horrible!!! stayed 2 nights did not sleep at all!!! so called "disco" very weird!!! accross the way super loud. looks nice online but needs alot of updating. alot of bars near by. We will definatly choose a different hotel on our next stay in Guadalajara.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel had seen better days. The service in the diner was excellent as well as the food. The area in which the hotel is located did not feel safe, walking was not an option, but taxis were always available.

review.title: Okay hotel to stay under budget. Do not expect any fancy in this hotel
review.reviewText: Okay hotel if you travel with budget. Helpful staff with sufficient English to communicate. The hotel needs attention maintainance. No elevators. Helpful bell-boy will deliver the luggages for you. The room that we stayed in the main floor was very noisy and we got exchange to a quieter room in the 3 rd floor once the reception got our request. Nice staffs.

review.title: Great hotel for Guadalajara
review.reviewText: San Francisco Plaza Hotel, with its reasonable rates and great location, is the perfect place to stay when in Guadalajara. Easy walking distance to the city center (about 6 blocks), and only 1 block from San Francisco Plaza itself, a beautiful park and church. The service is excellent, everything was as expected. The hotel rooms surround a peaceful courtyard with fountain. The breakfast buffet was extra, but well worth it.

review.title: Just what I was looking for...
review.reviewText: I am very satisfied with the quality of this hotel. For the rate I paid, this is more than I espected.

review.title: Not so good
review.reviewText: The hotel was very old, the bedroom smells not so good and the bed was not comfortable at all. Location is great because you are just in the city's center and is walking from a lot of attractions, I guess is not the best hotel you can find but considering the price you will get what you pay for.

review.title: "Not Impressed"
review.reviewText:
The hotel was OK,
one factor to choose the Hotel was for the interest to see the surrounding neighborhood (great Guadalajara area) ,but the at night it was empty and hard to find restaurant, just a couple of them were open.

review.title: Plan to go back.
review.reviewText: Yes, is very close to my point of interes.

review.title: Fantastic Last Time - Okay this time - Will give it another chance though
review.reviewText: This was our second stay at the San Francisco Hotel and the location is within walking distance of the centro historico. The service is affable,however this time our room wasonly satisfactory. Just old and in need of overall renovation. The hotel has beautiful courtyards and check in is a breeze. The rate was decent and I would stay there one more time.

review.title: NO SLEEP!!!
review.reviewText:
This hotel seems as though it was once a beautiful, quiant, and comfortable place, but it is getting run down, and the neighborhood leaves much to be desired! There is a dance/disco club directly acroos the strret which blairs music all night long and attracts a loud and boisterous clientele who start and end thei partying right outside the hotel. Prostitutes can be seen soliciting right out front, and the traffic is continous with loud trucks, horns blaring, and car alarms that don't stop. We got no sleep at all!
and our toilet backed-up after only a few hours.

review.title: City Center Tour Location "A+"
review.reviewText: The best part about the stay at this hotel was the "breakfast buffet" they offered at very reasonable price, large quantities and they provide anything asked for as well as a variety of Mexican food.

review.title: Terrific location, food and service!
review.reviewText: I'll definitely return to this hotel whenever I visit Guadalajara. We visited a number of hotels in person, on our first pass through Guadalajara. We had already chosen this one for its great location - close to the excitement of the city centre, but on a quiet street with its own small plaza. It has a beautiful peaceful courtyard lobby, efficient staff, and a restaurant offering food and service that rivals the best Mexican family restaurants in town (with a sunny courtyard for cheerful breakfasting). We'd already made decided to stay when we discovered a bonus - the discount available when booking through Expedia! There are a range of rooms available, some of them are in the old section, with beautifully appointed rooms. Ours was in the new section, spacious clean & well furnished. A small but important convenience: the hotel is just a few blocks from the major bus routes, and is right beside a taxi stand - which made our early morning airport departure a breeze!

review.title: Great value and location!
review.reviewText:
If you are a looking for a modern hotel with contemporary styling, this hotel or others in the historic downtown/centro area are not for you.

But I preferred the historic charm of this hotel with its courtyards and foutains as well as indoor/outdoor feel. The location was very convenient, within walking distance to most of the plazas, sights, and public transportation.

Cable tv, wireless internet, and room service were extra bonuses. I would stay here again.

review.title: Great Mexican ambiance, good location, and staff very pleasant
review.reviewText: Our reservations were at the hotel when we arrived, both rooms. We received the inside rooms that we had requested. The hotel is lovely and well kept. The staff very pleasant and the beds were very comfortable. The computer charged up and we were online immediately. We were able to walk to all the main attractions of Guadalajara without a problem.

review.title: Awsome Hotel in GDL
review.reviewText: The Hotel was great, and the staff made it that much better. They were so friendly and helpful, the restaurant was GREAT. The beds could have been softer, but I've had worst beds in mexico. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay and the location was perfect for exploring Guadalajara. I will be going back.

review.title: Pleasant Courtyard City Hotel
review.reviewText: Great 1800's multi courtyard city hotel within historic district on a small plaza,with helpful and professional service that is quick and easy walking to major visitor sites and activities. Best rooms are second floor

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was a great budget hotel. The service for the price you can't beat elsewhere. I would recommend to everyone.

review.title: Fine Time
review.reviewText: We had to stay an extra week and so we were there almost two weeks. The restaurant is very good food plus you get an extra 30% off for lunch and supper if staying in the hotel so it really makes it a good choice. The head person in the restaurant can speak English and the waitresses are very good at explaining the different meals. The front desk is helpful for whatever you would like. All in all, we would go back to this hotel if we were ever back in Guadalajara.

review.title: Inexpensive but noisy
review.reviewText: The hotel was relatively clean and the staff was friendly, location is good. The hotel has free and relatively fast wireless Internet services. However, the room was very noisy. Since all rooms on all floors are open to the inside of the building you hear the reception phone ring all night even if you are on the 3rd floor. The aisles in front of the rooms are stone covered and if a guest is pulling a roll-along suitcase past the door it is impossible to not wake up. Due to the high noise level I would not return.

review.title: Good value and good location, Needs a face lift, restaurant is less thab desirable
review.reviewText: The hotel needs some renovation.

review.title: It is OK!
review.reviewText: This hotel was a-ok. Not the best place in GDL for sure, but convenient enuf to most of the attractions that GDL has to offer. The bathroom plumbing wasn't the best or most updated, but for the price, you cannot complain. The breakfast is outstanding and recommend the buffet. Note, you will not be getting a 4-5 exp. This is a motel 6, Mexcian style. Cute enuf.

review.title: convenient location, but in need of new matresses
review.reviewText: The San Francisco Hotel is in a convenient location for visiting downtown Guadalajara. It is located in a nice colonial building with lots of character. The only complaint I have was the condition of the matresses. In the room I was assigned, they were quite old and I could feel the springs. I had a couple of nights of poor sleep due to the condition of the matresses.

review.title: Value for Money
review.reviewText: Value for Money.

review.title: Good location but...
review.reviewText: The hotel was within walking distance to many of the downtown sights. Our bathroom door would not close the whole way and at night when I went to the bathroom I saw a cockroach. Other than that, the room was okay. I would recommend this hotel if you just need a place to sleep and do not have much money.

review.title: A traditional Mexican Hotel
review.reviewText: I loved everything about the Hotel San Francisco Plaza. The people were warm and helpful, from the waitresses to the desk manager. The ambience of the hotel was pure colonial Mexico. Inside the communal areas-I guess they are courtyards-were cages with birds, splashing fountains, and tropical plants. I would take my book and sit feeling quite relaxed and cozy. My room was unadorned but clean and comfortable. I would definitely stay there again, maybe even this October.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Maintenance of air condition is poor. Check the air filter!!!
